articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Scientists fear Trump administration cuts to NIH could impact the health of Americans for generations
articles.description: Former National Institutes of Health Director Dr. Francis Collins, who abruptly left his NIH research lab in February, fears aggressive downsizing could impact Americans' health.
articles.content:
Earlier this month, a Trump administration plan to cut the National Institutes of Health budget by more than 40% was leaked to the press.
The preliminary budget sent shockwaves through the nation's health agency but also, the wider scientific communi... [11510 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Medical research brain drain: Why scientists could flee the U.S.
articles.description: The Trump administration's staff reductions and cuts to research funding could potentially cause young scientists to leave the U.S. in search of more stable opportunities abroad.
articles.content: For decades, the United States has been the destination for scientific talent from around the globe. Now, with the Trump administration's mass layoffs and cuts to scientific research at the National Institutes of Health, that could be about to change... [4647 chars]

articles.author: The Indian Express
articles.title: ‘Zelenskyy is calmer, wants to make a deal,’ says Trump after meeting Ukrainian leader in Vatican
articles.description: Detailing about the meeting, Trump said that it was a “beautiful” one and Ukraine’s President Zelenskyy asked for more weapons during their 15 minute interaction in the Vatican.
articles.content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday urged Russia to stop its offensive in Ukraine as he viewed his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy “calmer” and more interested in seeking a ceasefire deal, following their brief one-on-one meeting inside the... [1810 chars]

articles.title: Trump warms to Zelenskyy after Vatican meeting but is ‘disappointed’ by Russia
articles.description: US president says face-to-face improved relations with Ukrainian leader and demurs on trust in Vladimir Putin
articles.content:
Asked to comment on his meeting at the Vatican with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Donald Trump on Sunday expressed newfound sympathy for his Ukrainian counterpart, saying he “wants to do something good for his country” and “is working hard”.

articles.author: New York Post
articles.title: Greenland’s PM says island can’t be bought, calls Trump's statements disrespectful
articles.description: Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said that US statements about the island have been disrespectful and that Greenland “will never, ever be a piece of property that can be bought by just anyone.”
articles.content: LYNGBY, Denmark — New Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said Sunday that US statements about the mineral-rich Arctic island have been disrespectful and that Greenland “will never, ever be a piece of property that can be bought by just ... [2298 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: U.S. Strikes Intensify in Yemen: Debates on Civilian Impact and Houthi Conflict
articles.description: The U.S. ramps up military strikes in Yemen to counter Houthi rebels, sparking debates over civilian casualties. President Trump intensified these efforts, but while targeting Houthi capabilities, concerns over civilian impact persist. Democratic senators and rights advocates demand accountability, as operational specifics remain undisclosed for security reasons.

articles.description: EY Item Club predicts GDP of only 0.8% this year as Ipsos Mori poll shows three-quarters of Britons expect economy to get worse
